articles.headline: As a ‘Seismic Shift’ Fractures Evangelicals, an Arkansas Pastor Leaves Home
articles.snippet: Kevin Thompson thought he would lead his hometown church for the rest of his life. Then came Trump and everything after.
articles.abstract: Kevin Thompson thought he would lead his hometown church for the rest of his life. Then came Trump and everything after.
articles.lead_paragraph: To hear more audio stories from publications like The New York Times, download Audm for iPhone or Android.

articles.headline: Pulitzer Prizes Spotlight Jan. 6 Capitol Riot and Mideast Air Wars Coverage
articles.snippet: The New York Times won multiple awards, and The Washington Post won the prestigious public service category for its reporting on the attack on the Capitol.
articles.abstract: The New York Times won multiple awards, and The Washington Post won the prestigious public service category for its reporting on the attack on the Capitol.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Pulitzer Prizes were awarded on Monday to an array of news organizations for investigations that uncovered the tragic toll of the United States’ air war in the Middle East, exposed the dangers of a Tampa lead smelter and pieced together the full picture of the Jan. 6 riot at the U.S. Capitol.

articles.headline: States Turn to Tax Cuts as Inflation Stays Hot
articles.snippet: Tax reductions and rebates that are being proposed to help people cope could have the unintended effect of pushing prices higher.
articles.abstract: Tax reductions and rebates that are being proposed to help people cope could have the unintended effect of pushing prices higher.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In Kansas, the Democratic governor has been pushing to slash the state’s grocery sales tax. Last month, New Mexico lawmakers provided $1,000 tax rebates to households hobbled by high gas prices. Legislatures in Iowa, Indiana and Idaho have all cut state income taxes this year.

articles.headline: For Tens of Millions of Americans, the Good Times Are Right Now
articles.snippet: Their houses are piggy banks, their retirement accounts are up and their bosses are eager to please. When the boom ends, everything will change.
articles.abstract: Their houses are piggy banks, their retirement accounts are up and their bosses are eager to please. When the boom ends, everything will change.
articles.lead_paragraph: This is an era of great political division and dramatic cultural upheaval. Much more quietly, it has been a time of great financial reward for a large number of Americans.

articles.headline: Japan Has Long Sought More Inflation and a Weak Yen. But Not Like This.
articles.snippet: Rapidly rising food and energy costs, coupled with a plunging yen that has hit a 20-year low against the dollar, are weighing on a Japanese economy struggling to emerge from the pandemic.
articles.abstract: Rapidly rising food and energy costs, coupled with a plunging yen that has hit a 20-year low against the dollar, are weighing on a Japanese economy struggling to emerge from the pandemic.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO — For years, as Japan tried to boost its chronically weak economic growth, it pursued what its central bank saw as a magic formula: stronger inflation and a weaker yen.

articles.headline: Bolt Built $11 Billion Payment Business on Inflated Metrics and Eager Investors
articles.snippet: The start-up has had a meteoric rise, thanks to its charismatic co-founder, Ryan Breslow. But he sometimes stretched the truth to get there.
articles.abstract: The start-up has had a meteoric rise, thanks to its charismatic co-founder, Ryan Breslow. But he sometimes stretched the truth to get there.
articles.lead_paragraph: Even in Silicon Valley, a place teeming with entrepreneurs where fortunes are made seemingly overnight, Ryan Breslow stands out.
articles.byline: By Erin Woo and Maureen Farrell
